CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping.

Let's think step by step.

1. n-channel OFET: Organic Field-Effect Transistor (OFET) is a type of material, specifically a n-channel type.
2. bithiophene imide homopolymer: This is a specific type of material, a homopolymer made up of bithiophene imide units.
3. μ e : Mobility of electrons in the material.
4. 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 : A value representing the electron mobility of the material.
5. I on / I off : The current on (conducting state) and current off (off state) of the material in the OFET.
6. 2 x 10^7 : A value representing the current on/off ratio of the material.
7. V th : Threshold voltage of the material.
8. 75 V : A value representing the threshold voltage of the material.
9. fused - ring system: This is a structural feature of the material.
10. π-orbital overlap: This is a property of the material related to the overlap of p orbitals.
11. intramolecular rotation: A molecular motion that can affect the π-orbital overlap in the material.
12. oligomer: A small polymeric molecule.
13. face - to - face π-stacking: A molecular arrangement where the π systems of adjacent molecules are aligned face to face.
14. intermolecular hopping: A mechanism of charge transport between adjacent molecules.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. bithiophene imide homopolymer
2. n-channel OFET

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to the material name. The other entities are properties or features of the material.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| bithiophene imide homopolymer |
| n-channel OFET |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping.

Let's think step by step.

1. "μ e": Mobility (electrical conductivity)
2. "1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1": Value of the mobility
3. "I on / I off": On-current / Off-current
4. "2 x 10^7": Value of the on-current to off-current ratio
5. "V th": Threshold voltage
6. "75 V": Value of the threshold voltage
7. "bithiophene imide homopolymer": Type of the n-channel OFET material
8. "n-channel OFET": Type of the organic field-effect transistor
9. "fused - ring system": Structural feature of the oligomer
10. "π-orbital overlap": Overlap of the p-orbitals
11. "intramolecular rotation": Rotation within a single molecule
12. "oligomer": Small organic molecule or polymer
13. "face - to - face π-stacking": Alignment of the aromatic rings in a face-to-face orientation
14. "intermolecular hopping": Charge transport between molecules.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. "μ e": Mobility (electrical conductivity)
2. "1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1": Value of the mobility
3. "I on / I off": On-current / Off-current
4. "2 x 10^7": Value of the on-current to off-current ratio
5. "V th": Threshold voltage
6. "75 V": Value of the threshold voltage
7. "bithiophene imide homopolymer": N-channel OFET material.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| On-current / Off-current ratio |

| Threshold voltage |

| N-channel OFET material |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping.

Let's think step by step.

1. μe (Mobility): The mobility of the electrons in the n-channel OFET is 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1.
2. Ion/Off Ratio: The Ion/Off ratio of the n-channel OFET is 2 x 10^7.
3. Vth (Threshold Voltage): The threshold voltage of the n-channel OFET in vacuum after annealing process at 240 °C is 75 V.

These are the property values mentioned in the paragraph.

2. Ion/Off Ratio: The Ion/Off ratio of the material is 2 x 10^7.
3. Threshold Voltage: The threshold voltage of the material in vacuum after annealing process at 240 °C is 75 V.
